stlearn.em.run_pcaÂ¶

stlearn.em.run_pca(data: Union[anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, numpy.ndarray, scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix], n_comps: int = 50, zero_center: Optional[bool] = True, svd_solver: str = 'auto', random_state: Union[int, numpy.random.mtrand.RandomState, None] = 0, return_info: bool = False, use_highly_variable: Optional[bool] = None, dtype: str = 'float32', copy: bool = False, chunked: bool = False, chunk_size: Optional[int] = None) → Union[anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, numpy.ndarray, scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix][source]Â¶

Wrap function scanpy.pp.pca Principal component analysis [Pedregosa11]. Computes PCA coordinates, loadings and variance decomposition. Uses the implementation of scikit-learn [Pedregosa11]. :param data: The (annotated) data matrix of shape n_obs Ã n_vars.

Rows correspond to cells and columns to genes.

Parameters

  • n_comps â Number of principal components to compute.

  • zero_center â If True, compute standard PCA from covariance matrix. If False, omit zero-centering variables (uses TruncatedSVD), which allows to handle sparse input efficiently. Passing None decides automatically based on sparseness of the data.

  • svd_solver â

    SVD solver to use: âarpackâ

    for the ARPACK wrapper in SciPy (svds())

    ârandomizedâ

    for the randomized algorithm due to Halko (2009).

    âautoâ (the default)

    chooses automatically depending on the size of the problem.

  • random_state â Change to use different initial states for the optimization.

  • return_info â Only relevant when not passing an AnnData: see âReturnsâ.

  • use_highly_variable â Whether to use highly variable genes only, stored in .var[âhighly_variableâ]. By default uses them if they have been determined beforehand.

  • dtype â Numpy data type string to which to convert the result.

  • copy â If an AnnData is passed, determines whether a copy is returned. Is ignored otherwise.

  • chunked â If True, perform an incremental PCA on segments of chunk_size. The incremental PCA automatically zero centers and ignores settings of random_seed and svd_solver. If False, perform a full PCA.

  • chunk_size â Number of observations to include in each chunk. Required if chunked=True was passed.

Returns

  • X_pca (spmatrix, ndarray) â If data is array-like and return_info=False was passed, this function only returns X_pcaâ¦

  • adata (anndata.AnnData) â â¦otherwise if copy=True it returns or else adds fields to adata: .obsm[âX_pcaâ]

    PCA representation of data.

    .varm[âPCsâ]

    The principal components containing the loadings.

    .uns[âpcaâ][âvariance_ratioâ]

    Ratio of explained variance.

    .uns[âpcaâ][âvarianceâ]

    Explained variance, equivalent to the eigenvalues of the covariance matrix.
